about.name: Venice
about.info_text: Venice, often called the 'Floating City,' is a unique and enchanting destination in northeastern Italy. Known for its intricate network of canals, historic architecture, and artistic heritage, Venice is a place like no other. Visitors can explore charming alleyways, take romantic gondola rides, and visit world-famous attractions like St. Mark's Basilica and the Doge's Palace. With its timeless beauty and cultural richness, Venice is a destination that captures the hearts of all who visit.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 260,000
Region: Veneto
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: Italian
Currency: Euro (EUR)
about.climate_text: Venice experiences a humid subtropical climate with warm summers and cool winters. The city is prone to periodic flooding, known as 'aqua alta,' particularly in the autumn and winter months.

attractions_card.title: St. Mark's Basilica
attractions_card.description: St. Mark's Basilica is a magnificent cathedral known for its Byzantine architecture, stunning mosaics, and iconic campanile.

attractions_card.title: Doge's Palace
attractions_card.description: The Doge's Palace is a Gothic masterpiece that once served as the residence of the Venetian Doge and is now a museum filled with historic art and artifacts.

attractions_card.title: Rialto Bridge
attractions_card.description: The Rialto Bridge is one of Venice's most famous bridges, known for its arches, shops, and stunning views of the Grand Canal.

attractions_card.title: Grand Canal
attractions_card.description: The Grand Canal is the main waterway in Venice, lined with elegant palaces, and it's a popular route for vaporetto rides.

attractions_card.title: Piazza San Marco
attractions_card.description: Piazza San Marco, or St. Mark's Square, is the heart of Venice, surrounded by historic buildings and often filled with pigeons and live music.

attractions_card.title: Murano Island
attractions_card.description: Murano Island is famous for its glass-blowing tradition. Visitors can watch glass artisans at work and explore the island's colorful streets.

attractions_card.title: Burano Island
attractions_card.description: Burano Island is known for its vibrant, multicolored houses and lace-making tradition. It's a picturesque and charming destination.

attractions_card.title: Gondola Rides
attractions_card.description: Venice is synonymous with gondola rides, and they offer a romantic and leisurely way to explore the city's canals.

food_card.title: Squid Ink Pasta
food_card.description: Squid ink pasta, or 'spaghetti al nero di seppia,' is a Venetian specialty known for its unique flavor and deep black color.

food_card.title: Cicchetti
food_card.description: Cicchetti are small, flavorful snacks typically served in Venetian bacari (wine bars). They are a delightful part of Venetian culinary culture.

food_card.title: Seafood Risotto
food_card.description: Seafood risotto is a popular dish in Venice, made with the freshest catch from the Adriatic Sea, creating a delectable combination of flavors.

food_card.title: Tiramisu
food_card.description: Tiramisu is a beloved Italian dessert that originated in the Veneto region. It consists of layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Danieli
hotels_card.description: Hotel Danieli is a historic luxury hotel located just steps from St. Mark's Basilica, offering opulent accommodations and panoramic views.

hotels_card.title: Gritti Palace
hotels_card.description: Gritti Palace is a beautiful hotel set in a Venetian palazzo overlooking the Grand Canal, known for its elegant rooms and waterfront terrace.

hotels_card.title: Ca' Sagredo Hotel
hotels_card.description: Ca' Sagredo Hotel is a stunning, centuries-old palace turned into a boutique hotel, offering a unique and authentic Venetian experience.

hotels_card.title: Belmond Hotel Cipriani
hotels_card.description: Belmond Hotel Cipriani is a luxurious retreat on Giudecca Island, known for its lush gardens, swimming pool, and stunning lagoon views.

transport_card.title: Vaporetto
transport_card.description: Vaporetto is Venice's public waterbus system, providing a convenient way to navigate the city's canals and islands.

transport_card.title: Gondolas
transport_card.description: Gondolas are traditional rowing boats that offer a leisurely and romantic mode of transportation along Venice's waterways.

transport_card.title: Water Taxis
transport_card.description: Water taxis are a faster and more private way to get around Venice, with direct transfers to various locations.

transport_card.title: Traghetto
transport_card.description: Traghetti are gondola ferries used to cross the Grand Canal at certain points and are a practical and unique way to move around.

transport_card.title: Marco Polo Airport
transport_card.description: Marco Polo Airport is the main international gateway to Venice, serving a range of domestic and international flights.

transport_card.title: Treviso Airport
transport_card.description: Treviso Airport is another airport serving Venice, particularly used by low-cost airlines offering European connections.
